reviewText:
Fistful of Frags is a half life 2 mod dedicated to the wild west. It feautres a unique game style which rewards people on their notoriety which involves being able to be diverse in killing even using less powerful guns, killing people in different ways, getting kill streaks, ending kill streaks and shooting hats off people. Hence the player with the most kills may not be in fact the winner. Anywhere up to 40 people can be in a match which is usually utter mayhem.

Unlike other shooters which require running and gunning, this one dictates that you stand still and aim properly so that your rewarded with greater accuracy. It also authenticates the guns of the old, by making them weak, slow and rather heavy slowing down your speed.

Undoubtedly you will experience novel moments in the game like when I ran out into the street with no ammo just to realise that someone had my head in their sights, just as they were to pull the trigger a train runs over them. Talking about the trains its fun trying to hijack them, or confiscate a toilet demanding privacy, or play a concerto to a audience of axe weilding madmen. Probably the thing that had me most in hysterics is to crawl up to the back of a horse and shoot it in the backside. I won't ruin the surprise, but let's just say that the developers have all class.

There is now a competitive league for this game that showcases professionals at work. Having said that everytime i personally log into the game it feels like i'm up against these professionals. Take for instance when my team logged in to go against a few hispanic children. It was like the battle of Normandy but with sniper rifles. The game could hardly keep up with the amount of times it needed to respawn my team. The hispanic children were gunning us down every four seconds and if that wasn't bad enough, they were also using voice chat taunting us in several languages to show how versatile they are. These children were so professional I have no doubt that they were even multi-tasking while killing us, like stroking their cat on their lap between shots.

Hence I have a love/hate relationship with this game. The bots are often ridiculous in their difficulty and I never see a way to make them more docile so that I can learn the mechanics. The kicking system will have sniper players raging, there is no map in the game which prevents close combat forcing skillful sniping, two kicks from a player and your dead. Its easy for your character to get snagged in doorways and on furniture. Having said all that the beefs I have with the game are trivial if you are to play this game with friends. There is much to be enjoyed here and it's completely free.

The main developer has hinted that there are new player models and animations soon to be introduced in the not so distant future. There has also been a large amount of chatter in regards to steam workshop compatibility, steam inventory drop items and a co-operative mode against a constant wave of enemies. It's the developers dedication to his product and his listening ear to his fans that makes this completely free to play game worthy of a slot in your library.

With that in mind don't forget to crawl up to the back of a horse and shoot it!

reviewText:
I'll never get what makes these Free-to-Play (and by Free-to-Play I mean truly free to play/no money allowed) games so amazing.

Source engine has done it again releasing a title that has given me hours of pleasure to play. Everything from the shooting aspect, to reloading, to the gaining of skills (and luck) makes this game extremely rewarding when you walk away from the gunfights alive. In short, a Source engine made western shooter with realistic reload times, shooting aspects, and whiskey (very important) makes for a challenging yet awesome experience that keeps me coming back for more.

A true must have with no excuse, whatsoever, for one to not at least try it out.

reviewText:
Funny, light-hearted, even dark-humoured, Wild West-themed Source arena shooter. Also highly replayable: if you master the gunplay and learn the maps, you can be performing some pretty cool tricks.

Personally I've found the gunplay complements different paces of games (so it's actually quite varied!). So on servers with say 3-7 players, it's more about mastering the shooting and general gameplay...

Whereas on servers with higher numbers of players, it becomes a simply hilarious Wild West shootout with echoes of Pass the whiskey!" bounding about

reviewText:
I came into this game never having played it before. There's no old veteran bias (not saying that's a bad thing) going in this review, just a brand new player who jumped into the game knowing next to nothing about it. And what did I immediately think after playing a couple matches?

Un-effin-believable.

I've been wanting an awesome western multiplayer game for years after being teased with Red Dead Redemption's... so-so multiplayer experience, and this scratches that itch so freaking well. It's a little tough getting the hang of immediately, but a few matches in you'll start getting a feel for a gun or two, seeing how they recoil, how the crosshairs bloom with movement, etc. This isn't your modern shooter where just about every gun is accurate to a fault, this is the wild west where you're gonna have to get used to iron sights, heavy recoil, and frantic revolver duels that make this game the beautiful thing that it is.

Pros:
-Flawless gunplay
-Balanced weaponry
-Dual wield almost anything
-Excellent maps
-Pass the whiskey

Cons:
-Few maps
-Few game modes
-Relatively few gun options

Fortunately, all those cons should be going away in time. Fistful of Frags was a MUCH bigger game with much more content than what's on Steam currently, but porting the game over to a new SDK made the developer start from the ground up, rework the mechanics, and make sure the game is as polished as possible before he starts adding more content back in. Lemme tell you, the effort shows.

In conclusion, this game is FREE, and it's just a great, old-school multiplayer shooter that everyone should try. If you're a western fan, you'll love the crap out of this. If you're not? You'll probably still love the crap out of this.

reviewText:
On the surface, Fistful of Frags might look like a slightly underwhelming multiplayer shooter game running on the worn out source engine, which will probably only give you a few hours of enjoyment until it gets stale. Boy would you be wrong. Yes it’s true, the graphics are simple and the maps are relatively un-detailed. But what it lacks in visuals it makes up in gameplay. The map layout is phenomenal, with most maps having several different layers and ways to maneuver about the map.

Also what stands out is the different gameplay mechanics. Rather than the all too common, 'Run-n-Gun' gameplay you see with most common shooter, FoF has a gameplay style centered around accurate aiming. There is no fast pace running and you will need to be very heavy on the 'shift' key so you can walk slowly and place your shots accurately. If 'spray-n-pray' is more your style, you can press the left mouse button (usually dedicated for aiming) and be able to dispatch shots mush more quickly with huge detriment to accuracy and movement. You can even pick up two handguns of any kind and dual-wield them! How neat is that?!

Another thing that stands out is the choice of weapons. You won’t find any high-capacity assault rifles in this game. Nope, the base weapons consist of revolvers, single shot rifles, shotguns, blunt weapons for melee attacks, dynamite, and even a bow and arrow. There are also tiered weapon crates placed around the maps allowing for an upgrade to your weapons if you need a little extra firepower. Most weapons in this game are off balance, meaning that some are far more powerful than others. This factor is balanced out by the amount of score you receive from using each weapon, referred to as notoriety". Weaker
date: more skill-dependent weapons issue more notoriety per-kill and more powerful easy to use weapons warrant less notoriety per-kill.\n\nOverall
recommended: I would highly recommend this game. It’s really is no-nonsense. There’s no ranking system

reviewText:
Idk what to write, so here is a recipe on fried Chicken...

INGREDIENTS

4 tablespoons kosher salt
3 tablespoons freshly ground black pepper
2 tablespoons ground cayenne pepper
2 teaspoons garlic powder
2 teaspoons onion powder
1 teaspoon dry mustard powder
2 cups all-purpose flour
8 chicken drumsticks
4 cups buttermilk
Canola oil, for frying


DIRECTIONS

Mix the salt, pepper, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, onion powder and dry mustard powder together in a bowl. Divide the spices evenly between 2 mixing bowls. Add the flour to 1 of the bowls, mix well, and set aside.

Rub the chicken drumsticks with the reserved spice mix. Poke all of the pieces with a fork a few times to let the flavors seep down into the meat. Set aside.

Pour the buttermilk over the chicken, and cover the bowl with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Cook's Note: You can also let the chicken marinate longer, even overnight.

Add the flour mixture to a large re-sealable plastic bag. Remove the chicken pieces from the buttermilk and in batches, drop them into the bag, shaking them to make sure they become heavily coated.

In a large heavy-bottomed saucepan, pour enough oil to fill the pan about a third of the way. Heat over medium heat until a deep-frying thermometer inserted in the oil reaches 360 degrees F. (If you don't have a thermometer, a cube of bread will brown in about 3 minutes.)

Drop the coated chicken drumsticks into the hot oil. Turn the pieces as they brown and do not let them touch each other while frying. Work in batches, if necessary check the underside of a piece by lifting it with tongs. It should be a deep golden brown. Cook the chicken until the pieces are crispy and brown, about 15 minutes, turning occasionally.

To test for doneness: Cut into the thickest part of a drumstick. The juices should run clear and the meat should be opaque throughout. If necessary, pop the chicken into a preheated 325 degree F oven, until they are fully cooked.

Transfer the fried chicken to a paper towel-lined baking sheet to drain the excess oil.

Transfer the drumsticks onto a serving platter, or put into a bucket. Serve the chicken hot, room temperature, or cold.

reviewText: Fistful of Frags is like a western counterstrike. There are not enough western themed games out and the fact that it plays like CS just adds to the fun. The game is small and uses source engine so it should run easy on most modern pc's. The chaos that is a team shootout can be a lot of fun, or if you prefer to solo it in a free for all you can have that as well. Team play involves picking one of 4 choosable teams, the rangers, banditos, vigilantes, and desperados. Once the match starts bodys start flying. Overall the game has a good amount of weapon choices but few maps and mechanics however simplicity is not a bad thing, especially for a free game. I recommend you try Fistful of Frags yourself, you might have as much fun as I did!

reviewText:
I don't usually review games, but I've felt the need to review this one.

Fist Full of Frags sets itself apart from other Free to Play FPS titles. It has a unique scoring system in that the harder the kill was to execute, the more notoriety (points) you get. This leads you to get creative with how you go about slaying your enemies. AND IT'S NOT PAY TO WIN!

Pros:
Not P2W at all
Unique scoring
Can't just run and shoot; you have to either crouch or walk
Decent variety of weapons
Not P2W
Funny moments
Free
Multitude of game modes
Constant updates
Did I say no P2W?

Cons:
Some areas can be buggy (I'm talking to you, train)
Too few levels
Small gamerbase - but growing
Hatchet noobs

All in all, you can't really go wrong with this game. It's awesome and tons of fun to play with friends. I highly recommend you pick this up.

TL;DR - Pass the whiskey.

reviewText:
Fistful of Frags is a loadout-based multiplayer shooter set in the wild west. It focuses on it's unique gunplay and a whiskey-laden health system. It's movement speed is much slower than your average modern shooter, with certain weapons slowing your speed to a crawl, and others (mostly melee weapons) increase it to a brisk walk at most.


My first observation is the weapons, the game is loadout-based, although most of the best weapons are available in respawning chests found around the maps, these weapons are less than perfectly balanced, although the more powerful weapons provide less points on kill, which more than makes up for it, in my humble opinion. My main problem with the weapons is the lack of diversity, there is a few weapon archtypes (shotguns, rifles, etc.) and plenty of weapons in these archtypes, but they don't differentiate themselves enough apart from simple firepower, although the different items help to diversify your loadout.

The health system is a hoot and a holler, lost health is regained by drinking whiskey, but drinking too much whiskey gets you drunk, making your vision blurry and affecting your accuracy. This forces you to choose between being sturdy enough to survive your next fight, and accurate enough to kill your opponents at long range. It's an interesting twist on the healthkit formula.

My biggest problem with the game is the player count versus the map size and spawn points. The maps aren't nearly big enough for the amount of players you commonly find on servers, so people spawn behind people, you get flanked far too often and by far too many people. Smaller groups make the game far more enjoyable, as the spawns are much better when they aren't completely overflowed.


ProsInteresting health system
Point system is interesting and somewhat helps to balance the weapons
Interesting and not often explored setting
Unique loadout items and sidearms

ConsSpawn points and map size are not made for the average server size
Main weapons aren't diverse apart from set archtypes
Graphics are nothing to write home about
Final Thoughts:
Overall, it's unique, fun, and not like any other games you'll find. I'd reccomend you play with a small group, preferably friends. The game's not for the Quake or Call of Duty fan, Counter-Strike players should feel right at home, though.

Rating (Out of 10):
7/10

This review was written for and is published on the  Lit Reviews [LR] curator page.

reviewText:
10 epic reasons to get FoF!

1. You can kick a cowboy in the face and pretend to be a ninja cowboy.

2. You can mount up a badass 50.cal walker pistol, and you can have two at once!
(take that CS:GO!)
3. You can duke it out with fists like a real man! (why don't other games let you do this?)

4. You can rob a train.

5. You can throw TNT and watch source engine ragdolls in all their glory. (lmao)

6. You can a kick a cowboy off a cliff and taunt him as he falls.

7. You can kick ANYTHING!

8. You can be a crazed insane hachet man on a mission.

9. You can troll snipers and taunt the crap outta them.

10. It can pass the whiskey!  (best reason for sure)

In other words, what good reason do you have for not downloading this free game!?
This is one of the most well made and upkept free game out there.  There is no buying
crap here, no pay to win or DLC.  This is what an fps should be like!  The devs have done
an incredible job with this one.  Once you've got this, support it and keep it alive!

reviewText:
Fistful of Frags is a free multiplayer wild-west themed modification based on Source Engine.
The game consist of Deathmatch and Team Deathmatch. You can drop into a server pretty easily and begin causing mayhem as soon as you are in. A problem is that while choosing your load out, you can get killed, which affects your overall score. The aiming however, is extremely challenging. The weapons in the game are fairly varied. There are two standard set of primary weapons, one made up of shotguns and rifles and the other of handguns and melee weapons. You can also pick up bigger and better weapons, such as long-range rifles and bolt-action shotguns. Your secondary weapons come in a range of varying levels of usefulness depending on what you want to achieve. You could throw your gun, or you could use two sticks of dynamite or brass knuckles.
The graphics and sounds are ok, nothing new, but still not the worst.
If you like deathmatch games, you should give a try to Fistful of Frags. It is free, so you have nothing to lose.

Sounds 6/10
Graphics 6/10
Gameplay 7/10
Atmosphere 7/10

reviewText:
Pros:
* You can be a rootin' tootin' cowboy.
* Killing people in this game feels so good, especially by kicking.
* Despite there being only 4 maps (so far), the enviroments and uniqueness of each make up for it.
* The gunplay in this game is amazing, same goes for the style of the guns. The late 1800s was a very notable time period for the firearm, being the border of which how firearms were designed and functioned. That giant jump from flintlock rifles to revolvers to machine guns. (I'd love to see a Maxim gun in this, despite how horribly OP that sounds.)
* This game is VERY immersive, allowing yourself to play out several of those old-western scenarios we all know and love with your imagination. For example, holding out in a bank from bandits, or a massive cowboy shootout in a saloon.

reviewText:
Howdy.

Grab a six-shooting revolver, purchase a fifth-gallon of whisky, pass it clockwise, then download and install this game.  Why?  Yeehaw.

Here's what this game is, pardner: A mod of the Source Engine that plays out as a medium-paced, close-range arena shooter.  You create a loadout of Wild West-style weaponry and go into battle with a pack of curly wolves not unlike your-rough-cut-self.  The primary combat mode is free-for-all: Indeed, the close-range combat and synchopated flow of action work well with its battle royale" style.

Pony up.

The game's overall feel is not unlike Quake
date: with lots of hitscan twitch-aiming and weapon-swapping.  By the time you've made a frag or two

reviewText:
Product received for free

It's gotten to the point where I'm actually very good at this game. Here are some of my achievements:

- Topping a lobby using only Brass Knuckles, Throwing Knives, Boots, and Handgun Throw
- Topping many lobbies with Dual Deringers (pre-nerf), Brass Knuckles, and Handgun Throw
- Throwing said Deringers across a map and getting a few kills with them (you can throw handguns about 3 times farther than Halo grenades... seriously)
- Going on an 18 Kill-streak with the Sharps Rifle
- Beating up 5 people with Fists and Boots when I threw my gun out of reach on accident
- Getting a headshot through another person from across the map and killing both of them in one shot (with the smith rifle). I SWEAR I aimed this one... Lemme tell you what happened. I pulled up to one of the guys' heads and fired just as another guy walked past him going the opposite direction. Perhaps the second guy was only half-way on purpose, but it's still cool ok so leave me alone. ;c
- Sadly, the most I've achieved from one Dynamite is only a quad, but whatever
- Kicking COUNTLESS people off cliffs and laughing, and knocking people off cliffs using dynamite blasts and... laughing
- And the greatest honor any player can have... PEOPLE HAVE ACCUSED ME OF CHEATING WITHOUT ME ACTUALLY DOING IT!!! :D

This game has HOURS of fun in it and it's seriously worth a shot. The only downside I can think of is the developers. He wrote this long sappy post in the game's news about how developing it wasn't fun anymore and he was discontinuing development, and then he went and messed up the balance of the game (and took out a lot of the fun), making questionable and awkward changes to the layout of some of the maps, and even the nerfing the loadout system itself. This is not to hate on him, but seriously, you tamed a very wild game with these updates. The game was PERFECT after the remastering of the Creek map. There needs to be a version of that game still out there because it was way more wild, fun, and crazy. I have no problem with updates and changes, but you said you would not be developing the game anymore, so it gave me a false sense of security, and that's not cool. Maybe somewhere you said you were continuing again but I recall you saying you might be adding community maps to the official rotation and making a few tweaks" and that was about it. Sorry

reviewText: this is one of the few games I can safely say has a truly unique take on traditional gunplay. Fist full of frags' inaccurate guns do not cause frustration and diffuculty within the game, if fact, they are essencial to it's core gameplay which swaps the twitch shooter skills that dominate most FPS's for a gameplay expierience that relies on knowing how to maximize you chances of hitting somone, giving it a more tactical edge. Not to say that this is purely a methodical game, no, It is one of the most hectic, crazy fun balls you can find out there with it's health and damage systems allowing for some error while still keeping you from feeleing impervious. Pulling off a successful killstreak in this game is a challange and when the whisky bottles aline and you find *just* the right combanation of guns, you feel like a total badass.\nmy only possible gripe is the momentum system while a slow to medium speeds where going side to side feels a bit like waddling through molasis.\noverall: It's free, it's fun, it's original 9.8/10 download now this instant.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Fistful of Frags is an incredibly fun Free to Play competitive first person shooter running off of Valve’s Source Engine, set in the wild west. The wild west setting allows the game to be pretty unique compared to other shooters, guns take forever to reload and accuracy suffers often as a result of older cartridge/ weapon types. There are also some more interesting mechanics like handgun throwing, kicking, and dual wielding. Dual Wielding is something that I found really interesting in Fistful of Frags, it’s a risk vs reward type of choice as both guns will take forever to reload, as well as you lose the ability to “fan” (or shoot rapidly and inaccurately) with just one gun. The gun selection is fantastic, having a plethora of revolvers, long range Sharps Rifles, Coach Guns, Bow and Arrows, Dynamite, etc. Healing is interesting as well, there’s no regenerating health so you are non-stop chugging whiskey which heals you but causes your vision to be blurred and controls to be slurred.

Even though I only started playing this game in the past few years I feel a strange sense of nostalgia while playing it. It may have something to do with the fact that the game is often just simple team deathmatch without anything extraneous attached, or the lack of aiming down the sight (for most guns), or the fact that stronger weapons are re-spawning pickups found throughout the level. There is generic FFA, Team Deathmatch, and an interesting Break Bad mode where you try and trick armed players into firing on you as an unarmed character, or try to ferry packages to locations for money which is then spent on better guns. There’s a decent amount of maps and players for this game and it’s always a satisfying experience if you're looking for some mindless fun.

I highly recommend trying this out if you’re a fan of Wild West shooters, it's probably the best one out on steam right now. It’s free to play, but if it had been something sold on the steam storefront, I’d be willing to shell out money for this hectic but fun wild west experience.

reviewText: Faceful of Franky's Fruit is a fun shooty shooty video game that is also western. You shoot people and then try to reload and get destroyed. So, instead of reloading, pick up the shooty shooty device of some loser you just shot in the dong. When you spawn, you can choose a variety of things to start out with, including: A shooty shooty device, (or a bow or an axe but whatever) a secondary thingy (2 sticks o' dynamite, 3 knives, or the ability to throw your gun) and a perk. The perks are either: You wear some boots to kick someone in the privates harder, brass knuckles to punch people in the face a lot of times, or you become a gentlemen. The gentleman perk is the (obviously) the best one, because you must fight like a gentleman! Shoot someone face-to-face, have a fistfight, or other gentlemanly things to get extra notority! reviewText:
Fistful of Frags.

A Source Mod that allows you to unleash old Western deathmatch fun on unsuspecting victims. Kick them off ship decks, shoot them with dual Colt Walkers like Josey Whales, throw entire guns at them, kamikaze yourself with a stick of dynamite, shoot people's hats off and get points for doing so.

In short, this mod is good, it's ridiculous fun, the guns are all different and unique, the voice acting is so cheesy yet so good and you can scream PASS THE WHISKY" to your merry hearts content.

The problem is
recommended: it's a mod. It's a very nice mod and very refined in comparison with it's original version
hoursPlayed: BUT it is still a mod.\n\nThe dev gets no royalties no matter how many people play it or how many big name MLG teams set up for it

reviewText:
If better completely free fps exists, I certainly have not found it yet. Over the summers, Fof used to be my group's go-to game. If we couldn't agree on a game to play or we were still on cooldown from our last long civ campaign, fof it was! There were lots of laughs and yells to be found when one of us got the Colt Walker and went on a 20 man killstreak, or when one of us headshot another of us from across the map with that damned bow and arrow (still the only one with absolutly no idea how to actually get kills with it, truth be told). Or that time where my character had so much whisky that he could only barely see while getting dozens of kills with the Peacemaker in the bank teller window. Or that one time where we were surrounded by a dozen bots armed with hatchets, and we had to eliminate them django-style with our trusty revolvers.

We pretty much had our own designated classes as we mastered different weapons. Personally, I became rather proficent with the Colt Navy and could be a close (by fanning and moving) to medium range (by standing still and picking off shots) powerhouse, while one of my friends somehow found use out of the sawn-off shotgun. Nine times out of ten that you'd be a goner if you both rounded a corner at the same time. Intended or not, if given a little persistance, the dozen weapons of this game have multitudes more depth than any of the six-dozen weapons found in your triple A multiplayer fps of choice combined.

While the game doesn't really appear to have a plethora of maps at first, each map has little neuances and secrets that will make you change your strategies each time to give yourself every edge possible. Just make sure to watch your back on the bank roof while you're picking off targets with the Sharps.

This game was coming along very, very nicely until the sole dev suddenly stopped development over a heated fued. This is personally very saddening on a level I can't quite comprehend. All those memories of those glorious nights might forever remain memories instead of blossoming into new moments of excitment and adrenaline as the game evolves. It may be forever a pipe-dream, but the potential day where the single dev decides to give us another chance, will be a glorious, bright day. That day would bring smiles and sighs of joy for me, my friends, and all of the fof community.
Wherever the future may bring this game, I know it will be forever forward.

And if you haven't picked up the game yet, in that case, pick up the gun you most fancy, grab some whiskey, start shooting, and never look back. You'll thank me much later. Oh, and pass the whiskey.

reviewText:
This game is excellent. It's the Picasso's Dove of free-to-play source games. Simple, elegant, and beautiful in a way that the weak minded may not immediately recognize, but screw the two people who told me otherwise, this game is excellent.

It was definitely not in a Western shooter that I expected to find one of my favorite systems of close combat.

I enter a building, I go up the staircase. Two Desperados awaited, so I hold down left click to fan my schofield revolver so that I could swiftly shoot both down. Alas, another comes up from behind with a tomahawk, so I kick him ten fet away and chuck a knife in his face, and then walked up to stab him in the gut with my remaining knife. I drink some whiskey and continue on my merry killstreak.

What's so great about this game is that every situation has OPTIONS. Kick people away and they're momentarily stunned. Throw a knife if your clip is empty. Fan the revolver if you are facing multiple people and need to be as quick as possible. Light some dynamite if you're an ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥.

And as a result of both this and the counterstrike-inspired variable accuracy mechanic, gunfights often play out as you imagine they should. Good players navigate the map with calm, deliberate finesse, and even without the presence of Western objects and aesthetics, the gameplay itself too feels appropriate for the theme.

reviewText:
Do you like free stuff?

Do you want a free game?

Do you want a free FPS Game?

Do you want a free FPS game with a surprisingly high amount of content, of which includes: a variety of weaponary for every combat situation, plenty of maps to keep you interested and a bunch of gamemodes to compliment aforementioned gamedmodes?

Do you want a free FPS Game that is both chaotic, funny and will keep you occupied for as long as you desire? Do you want to dual wield a pistol and sawn-off shotgun, kill three guys with said guns, then use your last bullet to blow up a lit dynamite with the resulting explosion killing a further two enemies. Or do you want to run at a man with a shotgun with a axe in your hand, heart thumping in your chest, as you sink the sharp metal into the mans skull, relinquishing him of his weapon and using it as your own?! Or do you want to be a pacifist, only shooting the hats off your opponents, skipping away like an ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. Or maybe you just want to sneak up on that ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of a sniper thats been headshotting you the last few minutes, kicking him off the edge of his snipers perch to his untimely demise.

If you answered yes to any of the above, get this game. Matches are both fun and smooth and quick to top it off. Quite possibly one of the funnest free games i've ever had the pleasure of playing.

If you answered no to all of the above...  What!? You don't like free things? What are you stupid?! Get this game and hopefully a few braincells will wake up in that head of yours, free **** is free **** there is nothing to lose from getting it.

Oh, and pass the whiskey

reviewText:
Fistful of Frags. After it's publishment long long ago, it came out as a mod for Half Life 2. It is a Source mod Wild West first person shooter. Many thought it was dead years ago due to it's inactivity. But then now, It became a standalone game. Not a mod anymore! It was revived from the grave.

Jerma helped very much. Thanks to him for showing the most of us this hilariously adorable game. See, how many of the most famous game series out there, started as a mod? Counter-Strike is a mod, TF Classic, DoD, DayZ, those games started as a mod.

This is not your typical ''hold the fire button military shooter'' game. This is somewhat really unique, just like to that of TF2. That's why I really like them. You know, I've been dreaming alot to Western things. I built a Wild Western place in my Minecraft world. And don't forget, Clint Freakin' Eastwood, the Lone Ranger, The Dollars trilogy, Tuco Ramirez, Col. Douglas Mortimer, Man w/ Harmonica and Angel Eyes! See that how I love the Wild West. I am addicted to the Wild West. I am a big fan of the Wild West, just like that I have with Golden Age Piracy. But now it's here, in my PC. This game, has the Day of Defeat, Gmod, and Red Dead Redemption feels on it. Three games, imagine that, mixed in one game. It will actually turn out very good!

I had the most fun, most charms I find in a game is here. Just like TF2, this one is as well my favorite shooters of all time. See how I only have 5 hours on it, and I am excited to write a review of it, explaining how good this game is. Even though you're only 1 hours throughout the game, you'll like it so much.

So many impressions at the first place. Though, the game is still on process, let's hope many new  amazingly unique things come down the road. I am going to write down some of the postives and negatives I find in the game.

The Verdict

The good:
+The blistering style it has that of TF2
+Very unique features
-Whiskeys
-Carrying stuuf like that in Gmod
-Hilarious voicelines especially ''PHESH TEH WHISKEY!
-X-4
-The kicking
-The knife throwing
+That really impressingly amazing iconic soundtrack on the Main screen. Gotta wait for it to finish before I play the game
+The Wild West
+You can play with your friends
+Awesome logo
+Hilariously impressive Scoring (e.g the traditional Wild West Notoriety thing)
+Impressing voicelines
date: but I think each group of Cowboys should have different voices\n+Killstreaking\n+Only the badwass ways give you the highest notoriety. (eg. Kicking an opponent to a fire
recommended:
throwing a barrel at an enemy.)
+Each characters are badwass or the game itself already is!
+Hilariously impressing achievements' names
+The graphics always makes it feel much better
+OVERALL
hoursPlayed: AWESOME!\n\nThe Bad: (Though I know the game is still on the beginning of progress
voteText: I'll have to write it down.)\n-I want the theme song of ''The good

reviewText:
There I was, in the middle of snow capped camp, fighting for my life among the other outlaws who somehow found themselves in the same place.

Gunshots were flying left and right. Screams of pain echoed from every direction. Blood stained the once-white snow. It was a warzone.

I peeked out from the crate I had been taking cover behind, and fired a couple rounds at another sprinting man. I heard a shriek cry out, and he dropped dead on the spot. I try to roll back behind the crate, but before I knew it, there was an intense stinging pain in my right arm, and I was bleeding heavily. I had to get to better cover.

To my left, I saw a passage into what might be an underground room of sorts. I didn't even know what was in there, but I probably had higher odds of surviving in there than I did outside.

My feet stomped and slid as I clumsily ran inside. I made my way to the corner of the room and assessed the wound. A single bullet, pierced through my triceps. I didn't have any medical tools on me, and I was sure as hell that there were none around. I figured I would just have to tough it out, like I had already done countless times.

Suddenly, footsteps. Loud ones. I could hear them, about to round to the same corner I had ran through. I gripped my revolver tightly, preparing to make my final stand.

My heart was racing. I could feel even more sweat running down my dirt and grime ridden face. This is it. This is where I die.

A man, dressed in what looked like a black and white suit, stormed into the room firing a rifle. I fired what few rounds I had left in my revolver, and none of them hit. Next thing I knew, I jolted forward a little. I was coughing blood. I had been shot directly in the chest. It's over.

My vision was fading. Everything slowly began to look dimmer, everything was becoming quiet, everything was disappearing...

In my final moments, I heard a single voice break the silence. He said to me,

Pass the whiskey.""

reviewText:
Fistful of Frags is totally free. No cash shop, no microtransactions, nothing. It's a mod, but it's great as a standalone game.
The gameplay's simple, fast paced, and fun. There's no progression system, so you can hop into a game, choose your loadout, and start gunslinging. All of that said, it has a few flaws, such as a few minor balancing issues, community-wide weapons bias, the consistency of weapon box locationsbut these flaws barely matter as this game is incredibly skill-oriented. Veteran players possess no real advantage over new players other than knowledge and experience. Due to the simplicity of the game, it's really not hard to figure everything out after a day or two of playing. At that point, it's entirely dependent on your ability to adapt and your inherent FPS experience.

This isn't your everyday military shooter. It's obviously a western, but your favorite cheesy machine gun isn't here. Most of the guns are either semi-automatic or single shot, so it forces you to take individual aim between shots. The game inherently demands a good lot of focus, so don't expect to jump into this game anticipating run-and-gun half-asleep arcade shooting like your average game. A strong sense of ingame enemy awareness, reaction time, and individual placement will make you king. Of course, this goes for every decent shooter, but this particular game demands a bit more than its peers.

To all the chronic campers out there-- for the most part, Fistful of Frags' map design tends to discourage camping, connecting the walkable landscape between hallways, and there're always more than one way to enter a room or a rooftop, so can't turtle your favorite sniping position without constantly watching your left and rights, so be forewarned.

The guns in Fistful of Frags take a huge hit in accuracy when running to the point of unreliability, forcing you to either walk or stand completely still to hit anything. The weapons themselves are fairly balanced, though the game receives balancing updates every now and then. It may be important to keep up with this, as your favorite gun may not be the same as it was yesterday.

The most significant disadvantage this game has over other games is its highly autistic, rabid community of mouth-frothing neckbeard monkeys that seem to populate this game. Like all free games, you'll obviously meet people of all kinds-- for better or for worse. If you don't enjoy the occasional ♥♥♥♥-talking exchanges and the art of humoring terrible insults, you can either ignore all of it or pass.

From a competitive standpoint, maybe you shouldn't consider taking this game too seriously-- but you could. All in all, it rewards skill-based gameplay and is a highly rewarding shooter. There's always a degree of unpredictability and ♥♥♥♥ luck, but most people don't seem to know that the very concept of gaming uncertainty plays a significant role in the balancing of a game.

As a last word, don't forget to pass the whiskey. This can be accomplished by occasionally pressing X, and then 4. I hope this review helps, and most of all, have fun.

reviewText: It's amazing that a Half-Life 2 mod could become one of my favorite multiplayer shooters ever.  The gunplay is fantastic, and that's really the only thing that matters.  There's no progression system, yet I've been playing for over 50 hours.  There's no microtransactions, every weapon and map is available from the very start.  If you're a fan of westerns, this is a must-play, if you're a fan of FPS's, this is a must-play.  If you have even the slightest interest in either, just play FoF.  It's free btw.

reviewText: Chaotic FPS deathmatch game in a western setting. Uses counterstrike's accuracy mechanics. Reloading and firing speeds are painfully slow so every bullet matters to promote careful aim and quickly switching weapons/picking up new ones during long fights. More points are awarded for weapons that are more difficult to kill with (ranging from 6 points for gunshot to 12 or so with fists). Not that the points matter since its all a deathmatch.\n\nThe real game is in passing the whiskey. Once you can do that you've won.

reviewText:
Wow. Why didn't I get this before? I was on the edge of whether or not to get this, but then I said: Mmyep. Its free. Get it. Its unbalanced but has those funny moments ya know.

EDIT: OKAY SCRATCH SOME THINGS THERES A LOT OF PROBLEMS WITH THIS GAME.

A mere kick can kill a man with one shot (I get there are enhancer boots but still nuclear kick).

The bots.

Sometimes theres this glitch where you can't fire your gun, or reload it either.

If theres more than one person fighting you, give up, pardner.

The bots.

It will take months to memorize which weapon is which unless you look on the wiki.

The bots.

You don't really get to know the map until the 20 minute round is over, and by then you're still
confused.

The bots.

The weapons can be unbalanced (see my dilema with the nuclear high-heels above) and fights always come down to a lot of chances: 1. if theres only one person 2. if you have a better weapon 3. if you even saw the guy coming 4. if you are reloaded 5. if you are in a group with a team (optional, highly recommended) 6. if the person didn't see you coming 7. (MOST IMPORTANT) if the person isnt a bot. yea, a lot of chances taken with these fights, and in a few seconds, its over.

The bots.

New players might as well be trying to SWAT A FLY THAT HAS A SUGAR RUSH WHILE DRUNK EQUIPPED WITH A MICROSCOPIC SWATTER IN A ROOM WITH MIRRORS EVERYWHERE LIKE IN BRUCE LEE'S ENTER THE DRAGON SO YOU DON'T EVEN KNOW WHERE THE FLY IS *breathes in for 10 seconds* AND THE FLY ON A SUGAR RUSH ALSO FOUND YOUR SUPPLY OF COCA COLA SO GOOD LUCK WITH THAT AND YOUR ALSO KNEE DEEP IN A POOL OF CREEPY FISH THAT MOVE AROUND AND TICKLE YOUR LEGS ALL THE WHILE AVOIDING EMPTY SODA CANS THAT THE FLY IS THROWIN ATCHA. *sigs*

The bots.

The game does center around certain elements I had never seen before: accuracy and weight. Accuracy is the reason you land shots. If it isn't essential you can call the game CENTERED around it. Weight is more minor. There are a lot of weapons, but carry too many and youll be about as fast as Ganondorf in Super Smash Bros. Brawl. Weight is more minor because usually you'll simply drop a weapon you don't use
date:
or just look around the map for a favorite weapon that got you a good killstreak last game (if you even GOT a killstreak last game)

The bots.

reviewText: Pass The Whiskey
voteText: 9 of 14 people (64%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
First off this game is free, so why not try it. It won't hurt you. There are no in-game purchases either.

Introduction
What would a first person shooter be without good gun play? Let me answer that, a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ one. This game, however, has amazing guns. When one shoots the guns feel weighted, the reload animations are top-notch, and what makes the gun play amazing is the tension. Reloading isn't instantenous when you press a button. Weapons vary, but reloading isn't fast, meaning when you're engaging an opponent in a gunfight every bullet counts. Missing once could very well mean death, and health doesn't regen. The only way to regain health is by drinking whiskey found across the map which temporarily decreases your balance and aim.

Extra cool gun mechanics
Weapons also have some versatility. Pistols have a secondary mode where one looses their accuracy but it increases the guns firing speed making pistols good in close range by increasing damage per second and good at medium ranges with accuracy. I don't know what this is called, but the animation changes and you use two hands instead of one. However, This secondary mode doesn't work with the dual wielding mechanic, since the secondary button is replaced with your second gun. Anytime somone has a one handed weapon, they can always pick up a second weapon and daul wield them. It could be two of the same pistols, or two different pistols, two sawed off shotguns, or even a pistol and a shotgun.

Issues
All these weapons are pretty balanced except for one gun in particular being the sharps rifle. This sniper rifle is a gaurenteded one shot kill. I racked up 30 kills with this thing in one life, when I found a good vantage point. I don't nesicarly think it should be nerfed as it is only found in the golden crate which I mention in the paragraph below. Also it makes finding weapons enjoyable, since some guns are kick ♥♥♥

Loadouts and crates
One first spawns in with a loadout of their choice between 9 primary weapons, but there are more guns scattered across the map. To obtain a better gun one must find a crate. Each crate is in a specific location on the map, and they have three tiers. Least to greatest being blue, red, gold. crates can be found and when one opens, it they can choose between a few weapons. Each tier of crates has different set of weapons, and the gold one will have the most powerful weapons of them all. They respawn every few minutes or so, but it's not so short a frequency that people will just camp around the crate location. The best way to score points is to always be on the move.

Other fun weapons
This is a game themed as the wildwest, and it has some unique weapons as well. Most notably is the dynamite and throwing knives. The dynamite is a lot of fun, and it is a feasable strategy to hold it lit and run up to opponents blowing you and them up, and let me add that their body and yours will become a ragdoll and fly. However, its not nesicarly encouraged as suicide results in negative points on the leaderboard, but its hellafun. If you're killed while holding it in your hand it will drop on the ground, so it works quite well unless they kick you away. Which brings me to the melee. Fist fights aren't as fun as in say Chivalry Medievial warfare, as there are no types of punchs you can throw, but kicking someone does a lot of damage, and if you kill them that way the ragdolls physics again are satsifying to say the least. Throwing knives are nice as well, epsically since you can pick them back up.

Gamemodes
there aren't many gamemodes as of the moment. Only team shootout and shootout. I've seen FFA servers, Team Vs Team, and my favorite mode being 4 teams against eachother. I heard they will add more gamemodes but at the momment just expect a lot of deathmatches.

Conclusion
This is a really enjoyable free FPS. The guns feel great, and gunfights are tense and exciting. If I were to rank this on a scale It'd be pretty high. Don't forget to pass the whiskey.

reviewText: Games set up in Wild West are so few in number and usually not so well done that it's really hard to find one that would be worth playing. Thankfully this time we have one that in my eyes firmly grabs multiplayer FPS segment set in this time period. While we had games like Half-Life: Wanted before, this one is much more polished and doesn't have crazy weapons like hand-cannon(literally) nor a portable mini-gun. The combat ranges from melee, which occurs rather frequently, to rapidfiring revolvers to shotguns to breech-loading rifles and even bows and tomahawks. There're no assault or sniper rifles to rule them all as in other FPS games: each has its own drawbacks. It provides quite a different challenge compared to burst/auto-firing guns: you'll have to time your shots and concerve your ammo since rate of fire and reloading is not as fast as in other FPS games. Levels are pretty well detailed, of an apropriate size and provide full range of encounters: from close-quarter ones in buildings to long range outdoor ones; skybox most of the time allows you to climb on the rooves, which doesn't break the gameplay due to intricate enough level-design and guns not allowing a total domination just because someone holds a good vantage point. The only things that seems to be missing is an ability to automatically find a suitable server, using old-fashioned game-browser scares some people away in my opinion and maybe lack of gamemodes besides (Team) Deathmatch, but hey, (T)DM is pretty fun as it is, and who knows if it's even possible to invent some other gamemode which wiould still have a good balance. All in all this game is a great way to spend some time if you got bored of FPS set in modern-day world but still want to play a shooter game.

reviewText:
I'm reviewing the current version (available on 2014-5-17) which includes only two game modes and four maps.  This is a stand alone version on the Source Engine of the 6-7 year old mod (which I never played) for Half Life 2.  The game is in development with more modes and maps to follow.

This FPS is Old West themed and more of a skill based game than most FPS games.  It requires a bit of time to learn and a has bit of a steep learning curve.  If you're looking for running and gunning and jumping off of walls while regenerating health and shields then this probably isn't for you.  If you like your skill to count for something though then keep reading.

The game incorporates a dexterity system where you choose which handedness" you are.  Ambidexterity gives you decent accuracy with two weapons when dual wielding.  Right handedness gives you good accuracy with the right hand weapon and a penalty when dual wielding.  Left handedness gives you max accuracy with a weapon in your left hand but a much bigger penalty for dual wielding.  Weapons can be switched to the opposite hand with the middle mouse button.

Movement penalties for accuracy are very high when running but much more manageable when walking.  Standing still gives max accuracy.  This is important to understand and take into consideration if you want to actually hit anything.

There are a considerable number of load out options that must be explored for one to find the optimum load out for success.

The scoring system is not simply a Kill to Death ratio.  One gets points based on how many kills you make in a row
voteText:
and more.  Your loadout options also have an effect on gaining these points as well.

The game modes that are available currently are free-for-all and team deathmatch.  Pretty much self explanatory if you've ever played and online FPS game before.  The big difference here though is the TDM.  It's not just one team vs another team.  There are four teams in TDM!  So instead of having half a server to deal with you have three quarters of a server to watch out for.  This means more targets but it also means there are more players hunting you.  It works well and you quickly learn the distinguish the teams.  Working with your group will greatly increase your survivability and scoring.

The four maps that are currently available are well balanced
helpfulPercent: not too big
votesHelpful: not too small.  They're appropriately themed with what one would expect to find in a period based shooter.  The maps are
votesTotal: however
votesFunny: somewhat complex and can take many plays before you find all the paths
commentsCount: ladders
column16: and rooms.  Like any game one needs to spend time looking around and figuring it all out.\n\nWeapons can be looted from downed players and from special boxes around the maps in fixed locations.  The three boxes are Red
column20: offers the player a choice of weapons.  The Gold box
column22:
also heals the player fully.  Learn where the boxes are but don't expect that you'll find them unused.  The cool down period for the boxes is pretty long so camping them usually doesn't help.

The UI is minimal but what is there is informative.  To see your health one must look straight down.  The health display will only stay onscreen for a short time.  The display also gives you an idea of where you're getting hit from with red flashes along the edges of the screen.

Death typically comes pretty quickly since health doesn't regenerate.  The only two ways to regain health are opening a Gold box (full heal) or drinking whiskey (partial heal.)  Taking a swig from bottles around the map does improve your health but at the cost of accuracy.  Whiskey gets you drunk so your accuracy goes down as your crosshair wanders about making it more difficult to line up your shots.

The graphics are not stellar but more than adequate.  The sound design is pretty good and on far with other titles using the Source Engine.  The gameplay is excellent though and that's what is most important!

There are some balance issues and ping is a major issue (typical for FPS games but seemingly moreso in this one) but this is an early release.  The devs seem dedicated so I believe the issues will be resolved.

All in all I find this game to be very enjoyable and addictive.  It is free so you're not going to be out any cash for giving it a try.  I highly recommend this to any serious FPS player who is looking for a challenging and rewarding multiplayer game."

voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Fistful of Frags is one of the most refreshing and funny game I have ever played. In the first 10 minutes of play you can already feel the game's spirit, which is unserious but intense, fascinating and incredibly addictive as it could be to be a drunken cowboy with an hatchet. You just started? Don't be too snorty about the shooting and reloading mechanics. As in a western atmosphere, you can't pretend just to always run around shooting endlessly, rather take your time to immerse yourself into the game, enjoy the madness around you, and one day you will kick everyone's asses.\nThere are is a good variety of weapons, from the classic colt navy to the devasting coachgun, from the colt peacemaker to the Sharps rifle, from bow and arrows to the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ hatchet. You have low hp? Just drink some whiskey and return to the battle! There are different gamemodes, with teams and objective, or you can try the good ol' shootout": Everyone against everyone
date: so you can just shoot at everything that moves without concerns. What matter is the reputation points. You gain those by wrecking enemies
recommended:
you know.

PROs:
- A lot of action
- Beautiful western themed maps
- Cool weapons
- You drink whiskey to gain health
- Great developers
- It's Free-to-Play!

Cons:
- Not for serious people (nothing wrong for me)
- Graphic could be better
... But it's freaking FTP

date: I might just give this a go" and when I first started it I joined a deathmatch server and got a little pistol

voteText:
kicking and passing the whiskey for a very long time. And that was my first game.

The guns/weapons were small but unique with their own ways and surprisingly the bow is very good in a gun fight :D. Their are some bugs such as shooting and the bullet shows blood on the enemy but seems to miss but that only bothered me for about a second.

The maps are fun and unique with secret places to snipe and kill. The physics were pretty good and the graphics were fun and appropriate for this type of game. There are 4 types of teams

reviewText: This game is actually loads of fun. There are elements from TF2 and Counter Strike. They blend them together pretty damn seamlessly. You purchase weapons after you earn money for them like CS:GO. The weapons are all very western (Bow and arrows, Flintlick Rifle etc..) The graphics remind me of an updater TF2, the western motif really work's. It also kind of reminds me of Call of Juarez Gunslinger, which is a wonderful thing. For a free to play game I'd say give it a try. Here's to killing some Desperado's!!!\n\n-Casey

reviewText:
Great game! Probably the best multiplayer source mode I have ever played. I cant believe how fun is playing this game. It is very simple FPS and you get used to it in a few minutes. It is quite similiar to Lead and Gold but Fistful of Frags is free and with the first person view.

You can choose from 4 teams which doesnt really matter but the important thing is that you can change your loadout where are 8 (not sure about that number) guns to play with so you can make yourself a tough cowboy with a colt, soldier with a carabine rifle or you can take a bow and feel like an indian. But you can find better ones in some bonus boxes on the map while playing. The fact is that the basic weapons you can choose from are quite similiar to each other so it doesnt really matter which one you choose. There are also some perks" which you can arrange to your character to fit to your playing style.

UPDATE:
After continuing playing this game I can surely say that it is a great casual experience. It is that kind of game you can play when you have 20 minutes before leaving the house and want to enjoy some fun. It is no Counter Strike in the level  of seriousness mostly because of the game modes where it doesnt really matter if you die and there is no such a thing like team play cause the team is just the guys you cant shoot when you meet them. Also could have used some better maps and making guns more different from each other.

After all... great game with a lot of space to improve
8/10"
voteText: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Are you in the mood to kick some ♥♥♥ in a FPS but, your so tiredof the COD series?! Have you ever wanted to fight other people back in the Wild West?! Well! I have the answer for you! Fistful of Frags or Handful of Grenades, Brings YOU (the player) into a Wild West FPS simulation to meet all of your badassery needs. From bows to double barrel shotguns, THIS GAME HAS IT ALL, you won't ever feel a sense of bordem whilst playing this game. In conclusion, Fistful of Frags is an amazing f2p FPS Wild West game that should be download on everyones desktop\n\n-Pmarch365

reviewText:
Fistful of Frags, or FoF, is a 'Cowboy' first person multiplayer shooter that runs on the Source Engine. It has four different gamemodes, which are all extremely entertaining.
There are a good amount of weapons to choose from, and they are mostly all very different. You could equip anything from a bow-and-arrow, brass knuckles or dynamite.

This game will definetely make you laugh, even if you are losing a game or dying all the time.
The ragdoll effects are great, as are the shouting commands and the ways you can kill other players.
Whiskey restores your health.


I'm very saddened that 'haters' for a lack of a better word, have made the Devs of this game back away from it. This doesn't mean that the Devs will leave the game untouched, it means they will be in contact with the FoF community to ask their opinions on adding Community content to the game.

Although I only have 21 hours on this game, I would say I'm a good player, as it isn't the most difficult game out there. But it never, ever, gets boring.

10/10 pass the whiskey

reviewText:
Fistful of frags;

Fistful is a wonderful first person shooter game utilizing an old version of the source engine and a western based theme. The game consists of a few different maps, lots of different weapons, and four main teams; Banditos, rangers, vigilantes and desperados. The weapons are also correct of that period, the 1861 navy revolver for example; its a real gun! As are all the guns in fistful.(watch all the clint eastwood westerns youre sure to spot a few)

Tactics;

Now this is where it gets fun. So youre in this game, in your cowboy outfit shooting your guns, but theres a lot of ways to do that. You can 'run and gun', grab a revolver and shoot at people! Or, you can grab a ranged weapon, and get some distance between you and your targets. However, due to recent game changes, the rifles are exceedingly more difficult to use than the single handed weapons; more on that later.

The in game scoring system is reffered to as 'notoriety', again fitting the cowboy/western theme. The guns all posess a base notoriety, that increases incrementally with enlarging killstreak. More powerful weapons have lower base notoriety, so the sharps rifle has a base score of 4 points per kill, while the volcanic pistol has a base score of 10 notoriety points. This means that the easiness of killing a person with a powerful gun is offset by a low scoring bonus and vice versa.

Due to the placement of explosive barrels around the map (lol), it is wise to shoot them when enemies are near, this brings a large point bonus. There are also parts of the maps  that you can shoot through with more powerful weapons. Arguably the most powerful weapon in the game is the sharps rifle, which has a large magnifying scope that allows the user to see cross-map and accurately pick off targets. The trade off to all this power, is that there is a large smoke cloud infront of the user after shooting, and ofcourse also the loud crack of a rifle blast; both affecting the visability of the user.

Pistols and rifles;

Recently again, there has been a lot of change in fistful. The ranged weapons are the victims of recurring 'nerfs', such as the smith rifle, losing its accuracy and gaining a damage penalty. The schofield revolver however, seems to have as much or more range than the smith rifle. After all the rifle is for sniping, the pistol for medium to short range combat; Is it correct to have it this way?

Im sure that these nerfs are there for a reason, and im not here to question that. Im here to review the game, so now ill start talking a little more that way.

My personal opinion;

I love this game. Its fun to play for many different people, with many different play styles. Such a simple idea, and simple mechanic come together to make a game as fun as anything else ive played recently. It can make you laugh, and it can make you rage (due to the lack of cheat protection). But thats another reason to love this game, its soo course that you can use it how you want to.

If you want a good fps with a cowboy theme then this is for you. It will push all your buttons and tickle all your funny spots. However, if youre going to try to dominate, then it wont be so much fun. Ive been there.

To sum up, i enjoy playing this game a lot, and recommend it to anyone who wants to try it/ loves fps games.

Thanks for reading my review, have a nice day.

~CB.

reviewText: This game is one of the funnest western-based FPS. Theres 4 teams you can choose which are Rangers (Green), Vigilantes (Blue), Desporidos (Yellow), and Bandidos (Red). There are so many choices of weapons to pick. One of my personal favorites is the Sawed Shotgun(Stock weapon) and the Colt Walker(Top Tier weapon). There are Top Tier Chests (Gold), Mid Tier, and Low Tier. The game started of as a half life 2 mod but then devoloped into this amazing western FPS. There are many maps and theres a 4 Team Shootout (4 team deathmatch) and Shootout (Free for All). There are many shouts to the game as well. P-p-p-pass the Whiskey (x-4), and alot more shouts too. This game is really fun. No im not fooing around with you. The best part of this game is that EVERYTHING is FREE. So far there is nothing to buy. Everythings free. So I recommend you to grab some friends and play together in this awesome game. Its just loads and loads of fun with you started playing. Sure the games is a little sloppy, but it is fun. And mean it. There are handguns, shotguns, rifles sniper rifles, and more. You can also have duel pistols or even duel sawed shotguns. The game is really fun to play and the achievements are fun to earn as well. You can kick people, throw knives, and fistfight. I highly recommend Fistful of Frags. Thanks for taking your time to read this!\n9/10

reviewText:
I highly recommend this game as even though it's quite simply deathmatch, it's really fun. It's similar to a few games in some sense, however it's still it's own gameplay due to the movement of crates, stealing people's guns, opening boxes, etc. It's really quite something.

This game is set in the wild west, and there are four available teams to play on - And a great feature being that you cannot hurt your teammates, which are quite obviously pointed out!

The choice of guns and personal features of attack are simple to choose at the beginning of each match, and I would just like to inform you that this game, even though it's free, is definitely worth installing!

reviewText: Fistful of Frags is one of the best Indie games I have ever played. Originally, it was a mod for Half Life 2 that is consistently being update over and over again. It is a very successful Wild West FPS and in my mind one of the best in years. There are very few games with the same setting. In fact the only other Wild West FPS I can think of is GUN for the Xbox. The game has a few game types with free for all and team deathmatch being the most popular. The weapons are very balanced. One can go for a trusty six shooter with six shots before reloading or a rifle which is more accurate but punishes inaccurate shooters with a long reload time. All of the weapons are balanced so if someone picks up the powerful Sharps Rifle, they can still be felled with an accurate shot. It is a visceral and hard hitting game which really makes you feel each bullet you fire. I cannot reccomend this game enough as it has been a fantastic experience for free! Pass the Whiskey still makes me chuckle every time I hear it in game.

Best game in 2014 up until now and I don't say that because it's free.
If it were to be for sale, I would pay up to 15 $ for this game, because it's totally worth it.
These developers know what a game's about, they know that it's meant to be fun. If Fistful of Frags is not fun, I don't know what game is.
Big up for the devs! Thank you for this lovely and awesome game!

reviewText: Originally released as a mod for the first Half-Life, Fistul of Frags has been rereleased on Steam and is better than ever. This fantastic shooter allows you to don the spurs of a cowboy and wield some badass wild west weaponry to shoot, stab, and kick your friends. With a simplistic concept and unique, classic game mechanics,  Fistul of Frags is a fun little shooter that will keep you hooked for hours, just don't forget to pass the whiskey.

reviewText: If you are bored of the recent crop of homogenized multiplayer shooters, this is a great alternative. The gun-toting action feels fresh with a good sense of humor, Shooting that requires skill and strategy, plenty of map and weapon diversity (though at the moment there is only one character model) and it is free. Give it a try if you are looking for a fun, fast-paced and different multiplayer experience.

reviewText: One of the longest running Source Engine modifications even before the Steam release in 2014. Anything goes in this excellently well-humoured, beautifully-detailed and intense first person shooter set in the Wild West. No matter who you find yourself fighting against or where the action takes you, the goal is the same; be the most notorious of them all and have a grand time. You will certainly do so while akimboing revolvers, slinging dynamite, brawling with your bare fists or chugging down much desired whiskey all the way to victory. Just don't let all the Vigilantes mashing the 'Pass the Whiskey!' button intimidate you; show 'em who is boss!

reviewText:
Some reviewers warn that the game is dead, but that is not true in my experience. Every time I get online I can find several games full of human players.
I was skeptical, of a game based on reloading but this game is very fun. If you enjoy mastering challenging weapons, play this. The learning curve wasn't nearly as bad as I expected. I was killing more than I was killed within a day.


A vigilante walked into my bar with a pair of derringers and unloaded on me. Wounded, I dove behind the bar and started chugging whiskey, while he reloaded his pistols.  Once I was good and drunk I popped my head up and blew him away with my sawed off shotgun.

The game also has a great melee system. Brass Knuckles, Knives, Hatchets, and Boots are often as viable as firearms. Lately my favorite loadout is a hatchet and dynamite.

At another bar I run, on a steamboat, a bunch of yahoos came in looking for trouble. They started shooting and hollering, stabbing and killing, generally raising a ruckus. I lit some dynamite, let the fuse burn down for a few seconds, and then tossed it into the crowd. It killed most of them, and I hacked up the survivors with my hatchet. Like a true hero. No one causes trouble in my bar.

reviewText: If you are bored of the recent crop of homogenized multiplayer shooters, this is a great alternative. The gun-toting action feels fresh with a good sense of humor, Shooting that requires skill and strategy, plenty of map and weapon diversity (though at the moment there is only one character model) and it is free. Give it a try if you are looking for a fun, fast-paced and different multiplayer experience.

reviewText:
This Game Literally will run on a Potato WHICH IS GREAT because my computer is a potato and runs very smoothly
When i write Game reviews i try to get straight to the point, this game is a ton of fun with my friends you'll be running around shooten people up, and your friend run up saves your life. You got shot, time to go get some Whiskeh... Now you're drunk. There is a Ranger behind you and he is trying to get a headshot on you, but you have a Colt Navy. You Turn around and Fan him.... First bullet Hits {95 dmg}.... Then You miss everyshot... He Reacts and Shoots you in the Head with his Carbine. You laugh and hunt him down with an Axe...
Gameplay: 8.5/10
Maps: 9/10
Feel: 10/10
Fun: 10/10 {if youre winning} 7/10 {if you're getting kills but not winning} 2/10 {when you're losing and rage because youre feeding}
Fun WITH Friends: 9/10 DEFINITLY
Best part is kicking people off the edge or the enemy misses Every point blank Fan Shot, which is realistic

reviewText: I have always enjoyed this game! From the old western theme, to the old school gun selection, FIstful of Frags has always mannaged to take up a lot of my time. :P I love how the aiming system is skill based. Some people have trouble with this type of shooting however, but for any new players reading this, just make sure you shoot, and let the bullet" leave your characters gun
date: for a brief moment. thennnn press the WASD keys. You can NOT Run and shoot in this
recommended: if that's important to you.\n\nI also love the TeamPlay game mode. not only are you fighting the other team
hoursPlayed: or working with others to complete an objective against another team
voteText: but everyone loves how it feels to have the most frags/notoriety on your team/ingame as well. Gives it a lot of depth
helpfulPercent: (Another fun game btw if you like FoF).\n\nI do wish there were more TeamPlay maps

reviewText: My Grandfather drank his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of liver cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever drink. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through. I agreed. At 28
date: I have never touched a bottle of passed whiskey. I must say
recommended: I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it
hoursPlayed: because this game gave me cancer anyway."

reviewText: I am honestly bad at making these reviews, but not making one would be an injustice for this amazing mod/game.  Balanced gameplay plus fun gamemodes.  It plays very fluidly, a little similarly to Counter-Strike (Don't let that fool you though; it's not CS), even if it may seem unusual to new players.  With some experience, you can do some crazy things in the game:  go on a pump-action rampage, roam around with dual Walkers, snipe people with DYNAMITE!  PASS THE WHISKEY!  Or be a Delfy-like troll.  Hey, it's your game.  The mod/game is techincally multiplayer only.  I say technically because you can start up your own server filled with bots if you don't want to or can't play online.  It's free, and isn't intensive at all on CPU, so I would very much at least recommend you try it out.  All in all, this is legitimately a fun game, like TF2 was for me, once-upon-a-time.

My mother said to me- 'Don't ever drink. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through. I agreed. At 28
date: I have never touched a bottle of passed whiskey. I must say
recommended: I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it
hoursPlayed: because this game gave me cancer anyway."

reviewText: Fistful of a Frags is a very tightly built game. Nothing in this game is added for fluff. The game is very skilled based, so when you die you truly feel like it was your fault. The game contains a great deal of strategy, and the weapons are very balanced. There are a few one-hit kill weapons, but they have balanced downsides. The western style lends itself to the gameplay. If you're a fan of spaghetti westerns, you'll see lots of shoutouts, which is a nice bonus.

reviewText: Fistful of Frags is Red Dead meets Half life 2. It is a fun little western shooter with tight gameplay and controls. At present there is only 2 game modes, shootout and team shootout. They get the job done for now, this game would be perfect for some sort of CTF mode and other objective type game modes. There isn't many maps (at least that I have played) but ofcourse I imagine more maps will be added as the game is updated. However you cannot complian as there is endless hours of fun for the low, low price of free.\n\n8/10 PS: pass the whiskey

reviewText: Are you tired of running, Jimmy?  Have you ever ran so long that your legs hurt and your lungs ache with each breath in an agony that consumes your every thought?  Have you ever seen the snow fall, Jimmy?  Fall so deep and for so long that the whole world is nothing but blank whiteness and there is nothing in your mind but the cold cruel death of the space around you?  Have you ever had to watch as the love of your life breaths her last in a cold deep bed of soft blank snow?  Have you ever tried to run from the snow, to get away from the cold all around us, but with each deep breath you breathe the cold penetrates into your lungs with its icy fingers and you realize that all you have managed to accomplish is letting the cold take root deep inside you?\n\nWell Jimmy, maybe Fistful of Frags isn't for you.  Maybe you should just run home to your family and take care of them, let them take care of you.  Maybe you don't have to live the same sort of life that the rest of us have.  Maybe you'll have the privilege to live outside of the cold and the pain.  But for some of us there's no turning back, and I hope to God Jimmy that you realize what you have and can take care of it, because someday you'll see that you can't turn back and when that day comes you should at least have the sense to run.

reviewText:
If you like games such as TF2 or Counter-Strike, then THIS is the game for you!
Set in the early 1700s, when getting drunk on Whiskey while firing off a couple shots from your trusty Colt was no problem.
So saddle up pilgrim, 'cause you're goin' for one hell of a ride through hundreds of levels with only one objective:KILL
Dual-wield revolvers or sawed-off shotguns! Throw knives! Punch and kick people wherever the heck you want!
The NUTS? Sure!
Drink Whiskey to restore your health and get DRUNK while doing it!
Fight for 4 different teams: The Vigilantes, The Banditos, The Desperados, and The Rangers!

AND IT'S ALL (CENSORED) FREE!

reviewText:
When I played this game, I was felt instantly transported into an alternate dimension where all was right in the world. Dad never left, my dog was still alive, the cancer was in remission, and I still had my hopes and dreams from long ago. The guns in the game felt weighty and impactful, while the kills were very rewarding and immersive. When I got my first kill, I fell into a 34 minute ♥♥♥♥♥♥, that didn't end until I passed out from sheer dehydration and exhaustion. When I awoke, I had found myself in gallons of ♥♥♥♥♥, a weird taste in my mouth, and my hands on the keyboard and mouse. Within another 10 minutes, I was hypnotized by the aged graphics and glorious sound engineering found in Fistful of Frags. I was led to write this review in hopes of recruiting other soldiers for the eventual Fistful of Frags takeover.
Please join me, and let your body become a tool for Fistful of Frags.
Let it pleasure you.
Let it control you.
Let it consume you.
Fistful of Frags is Love.
Fistful of Frags is Life.

reviewText:
First, the negative:
Disarmed/jailed people nearly ruin the game for me. They block doorways, try to box you in corners, walk into firefights just so you accidentally shoot/hit them, and the end result is you getting jailed. PLEASE make the disarmed/jailed people no-clip and take no health damage. That would make me so much happier.

Bows suck. I've hit people 2-3 times and they still don't die. Hell, just a second ago I lost to a guy with BARE KNUCKLES. I hit him TWICE at point blank range!

The positive:
Overall, especially for a free game, this thing kicks ♥♥♥. Aside from the things mentioned above, this game is outstanding. I love it and I'll continue to play it, I just really hope those two things get changed.

reviewText:
Fistful of Frags...

THis is a Wild West Shooter based on the Source Engine.  So that means if you've played TF2 or HL2 Multiplayer, this is what to expect from the game.

The Singleplayer game, which is what I'm mostly interested in, has bots of varied skill levels.  They are all excellent shots so even on the easiest setting expect to be shot with an impossible shot at any time.   I really haven't seen much difference between bot hardness levels.

What this game needs at this point is more maps!  For a mod that has been around for 7 years, you'd think their Steam release would have more content.  Maybe Workshop content could help this out?

It would also be nice to have more skins available.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
There's not really anything to compare to this game. There is a lot of variety in both gamemodes and playstyles. It will probably remind you of counter strike with the short time to kill and simultanieous high skill.

I am a particular fan of the scores basis on skill over simple kills. Shoot a man to death for 4 points, beat him to death for 15. There are still dull as paint snipers with the modded weapon packs and maps, but there are many 'vanilla' servers and a lot of the modders got the right idea with fully moddable servers.

Oh yeah, and it's free. No price on purchase and no microtransations either. So you might as well buy it.
