voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Fistful of Frags is a F2P Source Mod arena-FPS with a Wild West theme game where you'll control a whiskey-drinking, dual-wielding, and literally ♥♥♥-(jump)kicking cowboys kicking each other and protecting their own ♥♥♥ from being kicked.

And when I mean free, it's totally free. No premium membership, deluxe pack, and hats, or any kind of micro-transaction. Fistful of Frags is probably the most fun and enjoyable Source MP Mod game on Steam, and one of the most actively developed game.

Gameplay (8.5/10)
Fun and simple, its one of those game where you just take out your brain cells and..umm..relax, except if you're a super-competitive one. FoF is like a slower-paced, Wild West-themed Quake. All you do is choose your starting weapon, collect another weapon in the process, drink 4 bottles of whiskey, and be a drunken dual wielding badass, and blast your weapons like a boss. Oh well.. who needs weapons when you have your leg?  The only complaint I have is because of the lack of game modes and maps, but.. you won't probably be bothered by that. Oh yeah, the A.I, its probably one of the better-programmed A.I imo.

Graphic (8.5/10)
FoF use Source Engine, there's nothing really special about it. It fits the game well, it looks pretty great, but that's it. Not that I dislike it though. Source Engine is still one of the best and most optimized game engine around, and of course light.

Sound (8/10)
Can't really review about it, again.. nothing special, but its still great nevertheless. You won't be bothered by that anyway.

Conclusion / Enjoyment (Pass The Whiskey/10)
A pretty simple and fun F2P game that offer up a solid MP and SP experience. This game is about blasting two sawed-off shotgun right in your enemy's face IN THE SAME TIME, drinking whiskey, (jump)kicking each other ♥♥♥, and being a total badass westerner.

reviewText: I have to say, being a western-shooter lover, this game is probably #2 on my list (Red Dead Redemption being #1.) It reminds me of Call of Juarez: Bound in Blood running on the Source engine. This game is meant to be Close-Quarters-Long Range. The Revolvers and Shotguns are the ones meant for near point-blank range-Close-Quarters. The carbines, Bows, and repeaters (lever-actions) are meant for Medium-Long range. I can't reccomend this game enough. The only flaw I can think of is the lack of people in some servers. 97/100

reviewText: This game is simple and a hell of a lot of fun. FoF is a western-themed team deathmatch Source Engine mod released on Steam as a standalone game. The main redeeming feature is the awesome gunplay FoF provides. Unlike other FPS which focus on fast firing, less aiming and large magazin sizes, in FoF it's all about accuracy. A single missed shot will most likely decide over life and death since reloading takes a great deal of time. The game rewards cautiousness and patience; easy to learn, hard to master. Whoever's the most accurate usually wins. It's great fun for in between because there's no progression system or anything. Just you, your hat and your revolver shooting up people with different hats and different revolvers. Try it out, you won't regret it, it's free after all.\n\n10/10.

reviewText: Fistful of Frags is a free to play source engine based online multiplayer shooter set in the old wild west. Suprisingly enough for a small f2p mod title it really is a great game. Clearly the graphics are a bit dated with it being a HL2 mod and all but the asthetic is pleasent and it's far from unplayable due to the quality. The gameplay is fastpaced, challenging without it being infuriating and exhilerating, the maps are massive and designed in a way that makes some nice unpredictable encounters possible as well as being full of interesting areas and secrets.\n\nThe guns feel powerful, responsive and look sweet as ♥♥♥♥. Not a single gun suffers fro pea shooter syndrome and the melee combat is often entertaining albeit a little basic. There's a suprising variety of weapons available from basic colts to one hit kill sniper. Each is well designed and in fitting with the old western asthetic (which I'm a huge sucker for [I love old-worldy guns of all types]). Another bonus is each update it just seems to get better. Highly recommend.

reviewText:
So, Cowboy of the Wild West, Mixed with Team based (or FFA) FPS action. What's not to like?

and, Free to play! but is it worth playing?

Yes, by all means, yes. try it. This game is a lot of fun to play, allone with strangers, of fighting with or agianst friends, this game wil take you on a wild ride.
But, no more then just mindless shooting? well, a little more then that. there are knifes you can throw, hatchets you can swing, shotguns to tear the souls from you punny little enemies. and, of course, there are the treasure thests. these boxes are hidden around the maps and can be opend for a reward. allwase a weapon. but with a choise of up to three when the box is open. feel you need some more power then some revolver? find a box, open it, and there you go! a shotgun for busness and pleasure. but, theres more. boxes I mean. three different veriants of boxes can be found. the lower level boxes open faster, but with less powerfull weapons.

And, if you find yourself with emty weapons and a angry enemy in hot presute, you can allwase trust you're handy hands. or, even better, the mighty foot.

So, worth a try? I devinetly think so, just go play and see for yourself.

and remember!
Pass The Wiskey!

reviewText:
Freedom is not free. Fistful of Frags is free.

That's a pretty good compromise.

FoF is a wonderfully chaotic-yet-strategic FPS set in the Wild West. The cowboy" theme permeates nearly every aspect of the game
date: from the characters to the weapons to health pickups (PASS THE WHISKEY!!!). The maps are also very consistent with this aesthetic and look great
recommended: for a Source mod. Said maps are also very well designed and play well with the game's mechanics. FoF's gameplay has more emphasis on melee combat than most multiplayer shooters. Meleers can choose from hatchets
voteText: knives
helpfulPercent: and even boots that can kick players off ledges and into water (which kills them). Of course
votesHelpful: experienced marksmen still have a nice selection of revolvers and shotguns to spawn with (more powerful rifles and shotguns must be found in crates throughout the map) as well as dynamite. Shootouts tend to have 4 teams instead of 2
votesTotal: which gives you more enemies and more fun! Great sounds
votesFunny: great production values overall
commentsCount:
very well made Source mod.

You can't buy happiness.
You can't buy Fistful of Frags
column16:
either.
Because it's free.

So
column17: by the transitive property of equality
column18: Fistful of Frags is happiness. Pass the whiskey today!"
